testcase

text-shadow on rotated text using -moz-transform: rotate is incorrectly rendered. It seems that the individual shadows are rotated in a different angle compared to the glyphs. See attached testcase. The same testcase (using -webkit-transform) renders on Chrom* better.

A real-life scenario where this issue appears is on the specified URL.

Will upload screenshots of how things render.

comments.text:
Last I checked, WebKit and Gecko meant different things by the text-shadow blur radius; one was twice the other or something.  Is that all you're seeing here?  I have to admit that other than the shadow being a bit darker in Gecko I don't see what the difference is between the screenshots...

Also worth checking: does the behavior change if you disable hardware accelerated graphics?

comments.raw_text:
I(In reply to Boris Zbarsky (:bz) from comment #7)
>I have to admit that other than the shadow being a bit darker
> in Gecko I don't see what the difference is between the screenshots...

Take the unrotated part of the screenshot and rotate it by 15 degrees counterclockwise in any decent image editor. Interpolation artifacts notwithstanding, the result will be a lot different compared to the way Firefox renders it.
 
> Also worth checking: does the behavior change if you disable hardware
> accelerated graphics?

I don't know if shadows or rotation are accelerated on XP, but I tested it anyway by disabling the preference in the Advanced tab of options and the issue remains.
